title: 51st: From Prisons To Weed, How District Life Is Different
dc:creator: Mikaela Lefrak
description: D.C.'s status as a district has drastically altered the lives of some residents, including people convicted of felonies and medical marijuana patients. Formerly incarcerated Washingtonian Jameon Gray and marijuana legalization advocate Adam Eidinger share their stories, and D.C.'s attorney general offers up solutions. This is the fifth episode of 51st, from WAMU's What's With Washington. To support the show, visit wamu.org/supportwhatswith.
